page.title: 08GOVERNMENT
page.content: A fire station is where firemen wait for a firecall.These men extinguish fires by spraying water from a hose. An operator tracks and directs patrolling fire engines.A rest room is available while off duty. Edlington Fire Station's area covers 35 square miles, including High Melton Sprotborough,Cadeby,Wadworth,Tickhill, Maltby, Balby, Braithwell,Conisbrough and parts of Doncaster. They have 13 calls a week Mostly for house fires.Their biggest fire was at Mining Supplies. They've never had a chemical fire. They frequently deal with prematurely lit bonfires close to November 5th (Guy Fawkes Night). They deal with vehicle fires. Trainees have a 13 week fitness course before joining. The fire station was finished in August 1983, and houses 1 fire engine and 1 rescue tender.
